subject: RE: [junit] Re: black box or white box?
msgSnippet: ... Sometimes you are just too close to the code.  Sometimes you need another pair of eyes.  Its just a fact of life--we are fallible. Again, the code is
messageBody:
> From: ilja.preuss@... [mailto:ilja.preuss@...]
>
> >
> > Two truths:
> >
> > * You can't know all the design from the beginning.
> > * You can't know all the tests from the beginning.
> >
> > It is an iterative process. As things fail, you add a regression
> test,
> > then you fix the problem. The order is important--write the test
> before
> > you fix the problem.
>
> But why do you wait for a bug report to add tests, if you can
> find out about the interesting boundary conditions of the new
> implementation by just looking at the code???


Sometimes you are just too close to the code. Sometimes you need
another pair of eyes. Its just a fact of life--we are fallible.
Again, the code is tested by multiple developers before a release
is made.
